definition: to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 300 sentences, you can make a living in America.
sentences.chinese: 脱口而出300句英语，你可以在美国工作。

sentences.english: If we had another name for this meat, people wouldn't even think twice.
sentences.chinese: 你若问起这种肉的别名，人们想都不想就会脱口而出。

sentences.english: The whole idea evolved from a casual remark.
sentences.chinese: 整个想法是由一句脱口而出的话演变而来的。

sentences.english: Every day I am blurting out more sentences.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，我都在脱口而出更多的句子。

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情绪激动之时，明镜险些将明楼的真实身份脱口而出。

sentences.english: Julia blurted out by accident. “I never imagined you being a doctor!”
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亚脱口而出，“我还真不知道你还是个医生。”

sentences.english: The world is tired of the death blurting out or muttering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 世界厌倦透了脱口而出或再三沉吟的死亡。

sentences.english: HATE liver and cheese, " blurts the Golden Retriever."
sentences.chinese: 我恨肝脏和奶酪，“脱口而出的金毛寻回犬。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 500 sentences, you can be a successful international businessman.
sentences.chinese: 脱口而出500句英语，你可以成为成功的国际商人。
我不假思索地脱口而出。

sentences.english: Finally I blurted my name out.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我的名字脱口而出。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 100 sentences, you can survive in America.
sentences.chinese: 脱口而出100句英语，你可以在美国生活。

sentences.english: " he burst out, exasperatedly."Do you expect me to drag him back?
sentences.chinese: 他怒气冲冲地脱口而出，”你想我把它拖回去？
你能不假思索的脱口而出吗？

sentences.english: B： I just practiced blurting out useful sentences every day for one year.
sentences.chinese: 我只是用了一年的时间每天练习脱口而出有用的句子。

sentences.english: The excuses pop out of their mouth non-stop.
sentences.chinese: 理由总是不断脱口而出。

definition: to blurt out
to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
to speak out/to declare (one's view)
to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to be at a loss for words/speechless
(speak) without thinking the matter through
to change one's tune/to modify one's previous remark/to change the way one addresses sb (as when one marries and starts to call one's husband's parents 爸爸[ba4 ba5] and 媽媽|妈妈[ma1 ma5])
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
a line of verse/a sentence
to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
to crop up/to pop up/to emerge abruptly
to utter/to give voice
